intro: Hieracium floribundoides, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium floribundoides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
